topic.title: I Know What you Download on BitTorrent
topic.body:
There is a website that can shows you (and others) all the videos you have downloaded via BitTorrent. Does it work ? can it be defeated ?

https://iknowwhatyoudownload.com/en/peer/

topic.body:
I think it's possible - here are some thoughts :-

topic.title: Backlink generation API
topic.body: I'l looking for a service that when supplied with a URL will automatically create back links from multiple sources to that URL. I have already created a simple one but need a lot more "power"

topic.title: TV Episodes down !
topic.body: Does anyone know what has happened to TV Episodes ? it hasn't been updated since March 30th !

14_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb.body: I'm with you, in fact I've already started !

> [seequ](#comment_1_19BZ9s633TaM3t7oW5bQPTPQJU3cbyibVH): ZeroNet is wonderful tech. There's just one thing that keeps me slightly worried: a zite that I pass by might seem innocuous so I don't explicitly delete it. Maybe it was at that time and later they added illegal content - or maybe it always had illegal content and I didn't know about it. Anyways, because I would now be sharing illegal content, I'd be liable.I wish sharing was opt-in, rather than opt-out, and that the UI neatly displayed all files the zite has before you choose to host it.

This is a very valid point and it worries me too. I'm not sure how to solve the problem of illegal / amoral content but perhaps some kind of warning system that would allow users to flag bad content.

1_1GgNo3CmxPd7n2pMSF3uyqf1XHvgtTUqCe.body: I gave up on Windows many years ago. These days it's mostly Linux (Fedora / Ubuntu) and sometimes FreeBSD. I'm going to look at Qubes in a while.

1_16J4P74LkfZ87zHug8ycEHmYdvp6wMdkXt.body:
SlashDot: Could giant alien structures be dimming a star ?
https://science.slashdot.org/story/17/05/23/011234/could-giant-alien-structures-be-dimming-a-far-away-star

8_1CnPgdHbuiXvD1M9xPU3UiXKmLwLLQKCVV.body: I agree that language is a problem. I see two solutions. 1. Provide some kind of filter that only shows sites in your language,   2. Provide some kind of real-time translation on those pages.

> [grable](#comment_7_17WG9sFaQoZCyRT7m89WAa23Ma4WYPifMH): If the top post is any indication, machine translation is NOT a solution.

Then I guess language filtering might be the best solution.

1_1F66E3MHhZtU9JT7K4a2sh7vZEn3CfcXCk.body:
I don't know if this is better than ZeroNet as I haven't tried it yet :-

https://maidsafe.net/

1_18cM73o7JT8droWw6aZHN85bRkJJMYCpw3.body: Perhaps it has something to do with their government ?

1_18JuREUrfUPwdwJLPA336tSjVaap8VSZp4.body: You can delete the site from your machine if needed.

13_1DLHbq2nvwpgU4xT3ajhABAW1Lfn3zTZhe.body: ISPs might decide to "shape" P2P traffic and make it much slower but ZeroNet should still work.

1_1P7ngox2iQVMeo7Tduop4SzDrHptzaSS6B.body:
Reliability: If my ISP goes down or blocks sites I can still see them on ZN.
Privacy: I can search for whatever I wish without prying eyes.

1_1FEJHHWenzcXnLaCETG7xGjp77Juc51KTB.body: In theory it should be possible. You could get updates via removable media like USB sticks.

2_1Jk6iv2QXUgZo4Y4P5ZUKe7SrpMnGs5unL.body: You could try DuckDuckGo via TOR or I2P

1_1AVHXMvRcmrB6Zcm7hg6JGF1CA5EGMJCCf.body:
I think it's been deserted, but there is a mirror here :-

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HwH4hfRhohJGVtZMBYprYKyHcuJNwL4sZ/

1509622092_1KdQMFyXwPY2vjMDL9UiPnckwGbyv.body: Good idea. Write it as a browser plug-in ?

1529063467_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: Don't be so hard on yourself,  I don't have a car and I do just fine !

1529063296_1G6QESmeipZsukJX5WvDxxwSioaGn.body:
> [nekololi](#comment_212_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXehoNAB): so you're basically creating a website with good SEO (lands on page 1 of a search) that a person is likely to click on when he is googling your name? it would probably work.

That's basically what I'm doing and it seems to be working - thanks for your input.

1529186253_1C9xLtM7PisNizDUt1R93vgYHaRN5.body: The volts and amps will just give the instantaneous power: 1.5 x 20 = 30 watts. What's missing is the time element but we can assume it must run for at least an hour to be useful, so best guess would be 30AH or 30,000 mAH approx.

Ooops ! I goofed - I mixed up amp/hour and watt/hours !
Assume useful time of one hour so 1.5 AH or 1,500 mAH approx

1529286685_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body: I like watching his videos too. John Michael Godier is quite good.

1536758231_1JjeqG6SnAvwAMynd7suwbAVyY4gn.body: It will be interesting to see what Google does when they are presented with the first invoice for linking to a news website. I suspect they will simply remove the link and let the news website sink into oblivion !!

> [thequickbrownfox](#comment_3_1JjeqG6SnAvwAMynd7suwbAVyY4gn5kdti): Wouldn't it only work with stuff like reddit where people are linking stuff? Google is just a search engine, if they are actually trying to make them pay for search results, then EU is seriously fucked.

Google links to stuff too, especial it's news section. This was tried before somewhere in the EU (Spain I think) and the results were hilarious.

1557991095_12kqbnJ3QpaT6extMyBhPzaWvbi8x.body: You could try www.FBI.gov and search there

1560284215_1NFEZa8hNrGfpw1EK4yRPWVquQJi5.body:
There is an interesting write-up here about the future of Darknet Markets :-

Dropgangs, or the future of dark markets
https://opaque.link/post/dropgang/

Basically, Darknet markets often get compromised by law enforcement, so many are using dead-drops and secure messaging.

1566184630_13ifSHXbs2RtyHF4qkn4GrJ3krWEA.body:
This article might explain why & where they went :-

"dropgangs, or the future of darknet markets"
https://opaque.link/post/dropgang/

IE is so last century - so who cares about that !

1573531510_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: I thinks it's good advice not to put your eggs in any basket owned by Google, Micro$oft, Amazon or any of them. It's best to have local copies and back-ups off-site.
